pullrequest.title: Make collapsible button of relevant display plugins "flat"

content.raw:
The last point is what I was questioning. It seems less self-contained… Let me explain what I’m thinking and then we can decide which way to go :slight_smile:   
  
The part that the display widgets' collapsible should be set to match those that do not have expandable properties seems "internal" to the implementation of the Displays widget \(caused by the fact that some displays are shown in buttons and some aren't\). Doing it programmatically \(with `setFlat`\) means that all users of the Displays widget will have that visual consistency "for free"; custom stylesheet or not. But doing it in the qss means that anyone that wants to customise the default qss also has to carry this property into their qss file, not because they are customising it, but just because it's needed to make the Displays widget look right.

I am with you that we can go either way technically, just not sure which is the better approach design-wise. Perhaps it is not appropriate for us to decide what is “right” for the display, and so it should be done in qss so that users can avoid it if they like, but it seems like unnecessary extra work for everyone else if we go that way
